image.altText: A close-up shot of a policeman wearing badges

props.synopsis: NT Chief Minister Lia Finocchiaro says Michael Murphy's position is "untenable", a week after damning findings were handed down against him by the NT's anti-corruption watchdog.

title.children: NT police commissioner to be sacked after 'incompetent' ICAC finding

image.altText: Wave Hill station sign.

props.synopsis: The leaseholders of Wave Hill Station have been fined for damaging relics of the Northern Territory's historic Walk Hill walk-off site, which sparked the Aboriginal land rights movement of the 1970s.

title.children: Station fined $250,000 for damaging historic Wave Hill walk-off site

image.altText: A man with white hair and beard wearing sunglasses

props.synopsis: An industrial manslaughter prosecution over the death of a Darwin construction worker in 2020 could be over before it begins after NT WorkSafe failed to turn over hundreds of documents.

title.children: 'Cluster of epic proportions': Industrial manslaughter prosecution derailed

image.altText: The outline of kids boarding a school bus can just be seen through the reflective glass of the bus windscreen.

props.synopsis: Parents in Katherine are urging the Northern Territory government to increase safety measures on school buses, after raising the alarm about fighting and bullying onboard.

title.children: Katherine parents raise alarm over violence, bullying on school buses

image.altText: A locked gate with a large 'no unauthorised entry' sign affixed to it.

props.synopsis: The company operating the Northern Territory's McArthur River Mine, one of the world's largest lead and zinc mines, has been convicted and fined for unlawful works on a sacred site spanning 13 years.

title.children: Massive Australian mine fined for illegally working on Aboriginal sacred site

image.altText: A young white man with long blonde hair standing by a fallen tree, which has destroyed a roof

props.synopsis: A series of decisions made by Daniel Spindler and his wife saved them from a once-in-a-generation cyclone after a tree came crashing through their dining room.

title.children: As Alfred bore down, this Gold Coast family had a lucky escape

image.altText: A composite image of two men looking at each other

props.synopsis: Donald Trump's recent barrage of criticisms directed at Volodymyr Zelenskyy have increased Ukrainians' trust in their president, new data shows.

title.children: Data shows Trump's verbal attacks might be helping Zelenskyy

image.altText: Side by side photos of Anthony Albanese, looking up in a green tie, and Donald Trump, looking serious in a red tie

props.synopsis: Australia is betting all its security chips on an ally turning inwards, not least because America's own ability to fund a global security umbrella is limited.

title.children: The last thing Australia needs is the Turkish treatment in Trump's new world

image.altText: A close-up of an old man in glasses and a white hat speaks into a microphone and gestures.

props.synopsis: Pope Francis is responding well to treatment in hospital for double pneumonia, the Vatican says.

title.children: Pope Francis shows 'good response' to treatment, Vatican says

image.altText: Smiling Indian woman in front of white and pink wall of flowers, wears pink and white saree, pearl and silver necklace, earings.

props.synopsis: One year after Point Cook mother Chaithnaya Madhagani's body was found in a wheelie bin, her friends are still waiting for answers.

title.children: 'What are the police doing?': Questions over Melbourne mum's death

image.altText: Family smiles playing uno

props.synopsis: Long-shelved board games are being dusted off as families on the Gold Coast make the most of prolonged outages.

title.children: 'It's like the 80s': Gold Coast kids make the most of power outage

image.altText: Multiple webcam screens show screenshots of different locations of Cyclone Alfred

props.synopsis: As Cyclone Alfred impacts the coastline watch the wild weather as it hits from the Sunshine Coast down to northern NSW.

title.children: Watch live: Cyclone Alfred webcam videos show wild weather

image.altText: Woman with blonde hair and a white jacked in front of a black and white photograph of a wooden pier

props.synopsis: Margaret's property investment odyssey peaked at 40 properties. At the other end of the spectrum, first-home buyers Justin and Lana are accustomed to disappointment. So how do we solve Australia's housing affordability crisis?

title.children: How Australia's housing market spun out of control — and what we can do to fix it

props.synopsis: Labor secures a comfortable victory in the WA election, giving Roger Cook his first win as premier after taking over from Mark McGowan.

title.children: WA Labor easily wins 2025 election, securing third consecutive term

image.altText: Smiling woman in black one-piece bathers in waist deep clear ocean water holding a bucket and a phone up

props.synopsis: An amateur fisherman's ingenious plan to use his phone to monitor his fishing reel backfired when it floated out to sea in a bucket. He couldn't believe his luck when the phone turned up three days later.

title.children: Phone lost at sea turns up after floating for three days and 20km in bucket

props.synopsis: Around the clock coverage of news events as they break at home and abroad.

title.children: ABC News Channel live

image.altText: A person uses a mop in the kitchen, in an image depicting household labour.

props.synopsis: When it comes to the battle of the sexes, new data shows women are still fighting much harder than men on the home front. Here's how some households split their chores.

title.children: Are men doing more housework? Here's what new data says

image.altText: coastal erosion at surfgers paradise

props.synopsis: Ex-Cyclone Alfred has caused beach erosion so extreme, it's left escarpments up to six-metres high in some dunes, including on iconic Gold Coast tourist stretches.

title.children: Ex-Tropical Cyclone Alfred gouges 500km of coastline

image.altText: A flooded home and backyard.

props.synopsis: Recovery efforts have started in communities where conditions have eased in northern New South Wales, though people are urged to stay on high alert amid floodwaters.

title.children: Lismore residents cautiously return, Grafton grapples with floods

image.altText: A blurry still shot of a white glowing ball in a partly cloudy night sky with an orange tail burning behind it.

props.synopsis: Dozens of people have reported what is believed to be burning space junk moving across southern Australian skies on Saturday night.

title.children: Meteor group 'flooded' with reports of space junk over Victoria, NSW

image.altText: Man's hands holding knife and fork cutting steak.

props.synopsis: Nutritionist Dr Emma Beckett sifts through some of the reasons why people are attracted to extreme diets like meat-only and keto, and what the risks are.

title.children: Is the carnivore diet just another fad? A nutritionist weighs in

image.altText: Hard Quiz host Tom Gleeson with his eyebrows raised and mouth open. The Hard Quiz logo is in the top right corner

props.synopsis: It's another week and a new chance to prove yourself.

title.children: It's time to strut your expert trivia stuff. Let's play … HARD!

image.altText: Georgia Voll smiles before an Australian ODI against India in 2024.

props.synopsis: Australia's Georgia Voll makes an unbeaten 99 to help UP Warriorz to a 12-run victory over Royal Challengers Bengaluru in the Women's Premier League.

title.children: Aussie Voll enters WPL record books after falling short of historic century

image.altText: A man looks at the rootball of a large gumtree that has fallen across two properties.

props.synopsis: Survival was on the mind of many Brisbane residents as they found themselves in the path of one of Queensland's most significant weather events in decades.

title.children: 'Grateful' Brisbane residents reflect on Alfred's near misses

image.altText: a replica tall ship sailing the River Derwent

props.synopsis: The Tasmanian replica tall ship, based on a 1800s ship pivotal to Hobart's colonial settlement, set sail with an all-female crew to celebrate this weekend's International Women's Day.

title.children: Pirates looted the Lady Nelson, her replica sails on, crewed by women

image.altText: A woman with long brown hair sits on a park bench. She is smiling wearing a black short-sleeved shirt.

props.synopsis: Australian businesses in the clean energy sector are being urged to shake up their recruitment processes as a report finds a diverse workforce is needed to fill employment gaps.

title.children: Report finds clean energy transition requires diverse employees

image.altText: Adam Lambert on the podium after finishing second in the snowboard cross event in Georgia

props.synopsis: Adam Lambert achieves his first snowboard cross World Cup podium finish of the season, placing second in the big final in Georgia.

title.children: Snowboarder Lambert climbs World Cup podium in Georgia

image.altText: Three young girls wearing hats and purple shirts stand arm in arm infront of a pen of cattle

props.synopsis: Millions of dollars changed hands at the historic calf sale but for those in attendance, it was about more than just money and cattle.

title.children: Mountain calf sales more than just good business for remote farmers

image.altText: ghost net brett peake

props.synopsis: The unusual discovery of a ghost net — a lost or dumped fishing net drifting through the ocean — washed up near Albany sparks concern for the nets' impact on local marine life.

title.children: Ghost net found on WA's south coast sparks fears for sea life

image.altText: A woman with brown skin and blonde hair wearing a silver medal smiles widely.

props.synopsis: She's one of Australia's most celebrated athletes, but it's taken years for Madison de Rozario to find herself.

title.children: How Madison de Rozario almost quit before winning Paralympic gold

image.altText: Jimmy Sing and Beci Orpin having a drink in her studio garden, with a brick graffiti wall and flowers behind them.

props.synopsis: A weed-filled rental garden became a thriving field of flowers in this transformation by friends Beci Orpin and Jimmy Sing.

title.children: Transforming a weed-filled rental garden into a thriving urban meadow

image.altText: A large group of people all walking together with cars parked between them.

props.synopsis: The clashes are between Syrian security forces and loyalists of ousted president Bashar Assad.

title.children: More than 1,000 dead after clashes and revenge killings in Syria

image.altText: Two men with snow sport gear on stand with an arm around each-other holding an Australian flag behind them. Overcast sky behind

props.synopsis: After three silver medals, snowboarder Craig Muhlbock is going for gold, while debutant alpine skier Lauren Kerjan is hoping to make her mark too at the at the world's largest winter sport event for athletes with an intellectual disability.

title.children: Going for Gold: Australia sends its biggest team to the World Winter Games

image.altText: Aerial view of a man rowing a giant pumpkin down a river.

props.synopsis: Rowing a giant pumpkin might seem like something from a nursery rhyme, but growing it? Mark Peacock is The Big Pumpkin grower and says it's less of a fairytale and more like a lesson in resilience.

title.children: How to grow a pumpkin big enough to row down a river
